Duterte: China, posibleng may gamot na vs COVID-19 sa Setyembre tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740288 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/740288/duterte-china-posibleng-may-gamot-na-vs-covid-19-sa-setyembre/story/ Umaasa si Pangulong Rodrigo Duterte na kabilang ang China sa mga bansa na unang makagagawa ng bakunang panlaban sa coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Fri, 29 May 2020 01:46:09 +0800
Duterte orders LGUs to expedite hospitalization of COVID-19 patients, vows to shoulder the bill tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740287 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/740287/duterte-orders-lgus-to-expedite-hospitalization-of-covid-19-patients-vows-to-shoulder-the-bill/story/ President Rodrigo Duterte on Thursday gave firm marching orders to local executives to attend to the hospitalization of Filipinos who would be found positive for COVID-19, promising to shoulder the cost. "This is really an order of the national government to the local governments: Help, do not deny, and you must expedite the hospitalization until he is cured. No problem about payment, I will pay. Just bill me, and I will pay," Duterte said in his address to the nation after meeting with top officials on the COVID-19 situation. Fri, 29 May 2020 01:29:13 +0800
Trump set to order review of US law that protects social media companies tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-740285 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/740285/trump-set-to-order-review-of-us-law-that-protects-social-media-companies/story/ US President Donald Trump is expected to order a review of a law that has long protected internet companies, including Twitter and Facebook , an extraordinary attempt to intervene in the media that experts said was unlikely to survive legal scrutiny. Fri, 29 May 2020 00:55:31 +0800
